title: The.Cabinet.of.Doctor.Caligari.1920.new.soundtrack
description:
Das Kabinett des Dr. Caligari (The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari) (1919)
From the DVD restauration released by Kino. With a new musical selection by JOLONQUE SOUNTRACKS (as an alternative to the 2 musical scores offered by Kino).
DVD Rip
AVI (Generic MPEG-4)
Codec: Xvid
Resolution: 608x480
Frame rate: 29.97 fps
Data size: 881.02 MB
Data rate: 1691.57 kbits/s
Audio: Stereo, 44.100 kHz
English title cards 
Spanish subtitles (srt)
Duration:  1:14:30

ABOUT THIS NEW SOUNDTRACK:
The music selected features passages from compositions by two of the greatest XXth century avant-garde composers: Ian Xenakis (Greece) and Toru Takemitsu (Japan). It also quotes from works by two famous theatrical composers from the "Weimar Republic" period, contemporary to Wiene's film: Kurt Weill and Hanns Eisler. It also includes experimental electronic music. The overall effect intended by this new soundtrack is to enhance the film's atmosphere, its enduring strangeness, its unrealistic technique, its eeriness and dance-like movements.

Directed: Robert Wiene, 1919
Prod Co: Decla-Bioshop
Assoc Prod: Rudolf Melnert
Sc: Carl Meyer, Hans Janowitz, from a story by Hans Janowitz
Photo: Willy Hameister
Art dir: Hermann Warm, Walter Rohrig, Walter Reimann
Length: 4682 ft (approx. 78 minutes)
German title: Das Kabinett des Dr Caligari
GB title: The Cabinet of Dr Caligari

With Conrad Veidt, Werner Krauss, Lil Dagover, Freidrich Feher

Das Kabinett des Dr. Caligari (The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari), is one of the most famous silent films ever made. Distinctive for its highly stylized sets and acting techniques, The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari represents both the earliest and the most complete manifestation of German Expressionism in film. Critics have variously characterized it as an extremely influential film that has inspired countless later filmmakers or as an anomaly in film history, a unique work with few imitators.
